sentences.sContent: It was the first time Hanna had been to the theater, and she loved all of it, from the performance to the champagne at intermission.
sentences.sContent_eng: It was the first time Hanna had been to the theater, and she loved all of it, from the performance to the champagne at intermission.
sentences.sCn: 我们曾去过一次附近另一座城市的剧院看席勒的《阴谋与爱情》。 这是汉娜头一次去戏院看戏，从观看表演到幕间休息时喝香槟酒，她高兴得不得了。

sentences.sContent: “So I had my little jar with a tight sealing top and a paper sack, and during intermission, I went to the toilet,” Dr. Kelsey said with a smile.
sentences.sContent_eng: “So I had my little jar with a tight sealing top and a paper sack, and during intermission, I went to the toilet,” Dr. Kelsey said with a smile.
sentences.sCn: 于是我带上了一个有密封口的小瓶子和一个纸袋子去看戏，在幕间休息的时候，我就去上厕所。

remMethod.val: inter + mission(发送) → 在发送之间 → 间歇

words.tran: 间奏曲；插曲；幕间剧；芭蕾舞表演
时断时续，间歇性；周期性
间歇性；间歇现象；间歇度
间歇抽油装置；间歇调节器

trans.tranOther: a short period of time between the parts of a play, concert etc
